sentences.en: Hard working. have the strong responsibility and professional mannerism.
sentences.cn: 工作认真, 责任心强,有良好的职业道德.

sentences.en: He has the same mannerisms as his father.
sentences.cn: 他举手投足跟他父亲一样。

sentences.en: He used such mannerism as " er " and " uh " to fill in a pause.
sentences.cn: 他说话间歇时总爱用 “ 呃 ” “ 嗯 ” 之类的话搭头.

sentences.en: He's copied that mannerism from his brother.
sentences.cn: 他的那些言谈举止是模仿他哥哥的.

sentences.en: Her British accent is just a mannerism picked up on her visit to London.
sentences.cn: 她的英国口音是她访问伦敦学会的.

sentences.en: His mannerisms are more those of a preoccupied maths professor.
sentences.cn: 他的言谈举止更像是一个全神贯注的数学教授。

sentences.en: Typical or indicative of prayer mannerism, gesture, or facial expression.
sentences.cn: 祈祷者式的在风格 、 动作或脸部表面等方面象征或表示祈祷(者)的.

words.tran_cn: 矫饰的；守规矩的；矫揉造作的
方式；习惯；种类；规矩；风俗
特殊习惯；矫揉造作；怪癖

trans.tran_cn: 习性，言谈举止，（绘画、写作中）过分的独特风格，风格主义
trans.tran_en: Someone's mannerisms are the gestures or ways of speaking that are very characteristic of them, and which they often use
